title: President appoints Commissioner General for Essential Services
byline: Secretary to the Ministry of Plantation and Community Infrastructure Mr. Prabath Chandrakeerthi has been appointed as the Commissioner General of Essential Services.

title: Limited train services to operate today – Railway Department
byline: The Department of Railways has made an announcement regarding the train operations scheduled for today (30) amidst the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Cyclonic Storm “Ditwah” is centered near latitude 10.7°N and longitude 80.6°E, about 130 km North of Jaffna at 11.30 p.m. on 29 November, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Indian Air Force helicopters arrive in Sri Lanka for disaster rescue operations
byline: Two MI-17V5 helicopters of the Indian Air Force, with 22 crew members and humanitarian assistance  has arrived in Sri Lanka to support ongoing search and rescue operations in disaster-affected areas, the Sri Lanka Air Force announced.

title: Residents urged to evacuate low-lying areas amid flood risk from Ambatale Bund overflow
byline: The District Secretary of Colombo has urged residents living along both sides of roads in low-lying areas, including Kaduwela to Malabe, Athurugiriya to Malabe, and Malabe to Battaramulla, to evacuate to safer locations.

title: Tom Stoppard, playwright who dazzled with verbal gymnastics, dies aged 88
byline: “What’s it about?” was a frequent response from bemused theatre-goers to “Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead”, Tom Stoppard’s first stage triumph.

title: Kotugoda grid substation temporarily shut down due to flooding
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has temporarily shut down its Kotugoda grid substation following severe flooding in the area, the CEB confirmed.

title: Highest rainfall in last 24 hours recorded from Pokkanai, Kilinochchi – DMC
byline: The highest rainfall within the last 24 hours has been reported from Pokkanai in Kilinochchi, with rainfall levels recording 274 mm, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said.

title: Police urge public to avoid visiting flood-affected areas
byline: The public has been requested to refrain from engaging in siteseeing visits to flood-affected areas, damaged bridges, and other inundated locations.

title: Türkiye expresses condolences to victims of Cyclone ‘Ditwah’ in Sri Lanka
byline: The Republic of Türkiye, through its Ministry of Foreign Affairs, has expressed deep sorrow over the loss of lives caused by floods and landslides in Sri Lanka following Cyclone ‘Ditwah.’

title: Landslide in Melsiripura kills five including infant, 9 missing
byline: Five people, including a three-month-old infant, have been reported dead after a landslide struck the Kandumalla area of Melsiripura.

title: Passengers advised to use expressway as floods disrupt BIA access; Visitors restricted
byline: Due to adverse weather conditions affecting several access roads, passengers traveling to Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) are advised to use the Colombo–Katunayake Expressway for a safer journey.

title: Kelani River water level rising towards major flood situation
byline: The water level of the Kelani River is reportedly rising continuously and approaching a major flood situation.

title: Air Force rescues 121 individuals who were trapped near Mavil Aru Anicut
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force has rescued 121 individuals who were trapped near the Mavil Aru Anicut.

title: Landslide damages section of Talawakelle–Tawalantenne road
byline: A section of approximately 100 meters near Paluwatta in Kotmale along the Talawakelle – Tawalantenne road has been damaged by a landslide.

title: Buildings in Peradeniya along Mahaweli River banks at risk of collapsing
byline: With the decline in water levels of the Mahaweli River in Peradeniya and Gannoruwa, information has been reported indicating a risk of landslides affecting numerous buildings along the riverbanks.

title: Red Alert issued for gusty winds despite Cyclone “Ditwah” moving away from Sri Lanka
byline: Cyclone “Ditwah” is currently centered near latitude 11.1°N and longitude 80.6°E, about 170 km North-northeast of Jaffna and it is very likely to move northwards, away from Sri Lanka, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Residents evacuated from vicinity of Mavil Aru Anicut
byline: Steps have been taken to immediately evacuate the residents in the vicinity of Mavil Aru Anicut due to water overflowing from the top of the bund, the Governor of the Eastern Province, Jayantha Lal Ratnasekera stated.

title: Pakistan to send mobile field hospital to provide medical care for flood victims in Sri Lanka
byline: Pakistan’s National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) has launched a relief operation for flood-affected people in Sri Lanka.

title: Water level of Kalu Ganga expected to rise further
byline: Flooding affecting the low-lying areas within the Kalu Ganga basin could develop into a significant flood situation in the next few hours, the Department of Irrigation has warned.

title: Nine reported missing after landslide in Welimada
byline: Nine people are reported missing after a landslide struck the Rendapola area of Welimada.

title: Emergency relief measures offered to Sri Lankans will be in place through December, Starlink confirms
byline: Starlink announced emergency relief measures for communities in Indonesia and Sri Lanka devastated by severe flooding triggered by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: No fuel price revision for December - CPC
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has announced that there will be no revision of fuel prices for the month of December 2025.

title: Child Affairs Minister requests to reopen daycare centers from tomorrow
byline: The Minister of Women and Child Affairs, Saroja Savithri Paulraj has made a request to reopen daycare centers that are able to operate starting tomorrow (December 1).

title: Veterinary Association on standby to provide assistance for animals affected by floods
byline: The Sri Lanka Veterinary Association (SLVA) has announced its readiness to provide assistance to pets, livestock and stray animals affected or trapped by the ongoing flood situation across the island.

title: All exams including 2025 A/L examination postponed indefinitely
byline: The Department of Examinations has announced that the 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination, along with all other examinations scheduled to be held, has been postponed indefinitely.

title: Sri Lanka’s death toll from adverse weather climbs to 193
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country in the past few days has climbed to 193, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed.

title: Bridge near Yakkala Ayurveda caving in, section of Colombo-Kandy road closed temporarily
byline: The center of the bridge near Yakkala Ayurveda along the main Colombo-Kandy road is caving in, according to the Chairman of the Gampaha District Coordination Committee, Deputy Minister Mahinda Jayasinghe.

title: 23 dead, 10 houses destroyed in Sarasavigama, Peradeniya landslide
byline: Another landslide has been reported from Sarasavigama, Peradeniya owing to heavy rains in the area.

title: Death toll from floods and landslides surpasses 200
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country in the past few days has climbed to 212, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed.

title: Public urged to pay close attention to announcements issued by Irrigation Dept.
byline: Although heavy rainfall has subsided, the Director General of the Department of Meteorology, Athula Karunanayake has urged the general public to continuously pay close attention to the announcements issued by the Department of Irrigation regarding the flood threat, as the water received in the central regions is gradually flowing downstream.

title: CEB requests rooftop solar owners to voluntarily switch off solar inverters
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has requested owners of rooftop solar panels to voluntarily switch off their solar inverters until 03.00 p.m. today (30).

title: Several trains to function this evening
byline: A number of trains will function this evening (30) to transport those engaged in essential services, Sri Lanka Railways has announced.

title: National parks and Dehiwala Zoo to reopen tomorrow
byline: The Department of Wildlife Conservation has decided to reopen national parks that are under its management tomorrow (01).

title: Litro says adequate supply of gas available in the market
byline: The Litro Gas Company states that there is an adequate supply of gas available in the market at present and that refilling operations are continuing without interruption.

title: Dedicated telephone numbers issued for tourists affected by adverse weather
byline: The Sri Lanka Police has issued dedicated phone numbers for foreign nationals visiting Sri Lanka who are affected by the on-going adverse weather conditions.

title: Sri Lanka’s death toll from adverse weather climbs to 334, 88 deaths in Kandy
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country in the past few days has climbed to 334, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed.

title: Risk of infectious diseases spreading among children high, experts warn
byline: Consultant Paediatrician Dr. Deepal Perera says due to the current widespread flooding and disaster situation, there is a higher likelihood of infectious diseases spreading among children.

title: Helicopter engaged in disaster relief operations crash lands in Wennappuwa
byline: A Bell 212 helicopter belonging to the Sri Lanka Air Force, which was involved in disaster relief operations, has met with an accident, police stated.

title: Crew members aboard crashed helicopter rescued and admitted to hospital
byline: A Sri Lanka Air Force Bell 212 helicopter, engaged in rescue operations for people affected by adverse weather, met with an accident. The incident occurred in the area between Lunuwila and Wennappuwa.

title: Landslides reported in Riverston
byline: A number of landslides have been reported in Riverston, Matale.

title: CEB hopes to restore electricity as quickly as possible
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has confirmed that Badulla and the Central Province are the regions most affected by power supply interruptions due to adverse weather conditions.

title: Measures taken to fully restore water supply within three days – Water Board
byline: Measures are being taken to fully restore water supply within three days to the districts affected by adverse weather conditions, the Chairman of the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB), Engineer A. M. P. C. T. Bandara stated.

title: President to address the nation today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to address the nation at 8:30 p.m. today (30).

title: Academic activities of all universities and higher education institutes suspended until Dec. 8
byline: All universities, higher education institutes, and vocational training institutions under the purview of the Ministry of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education will suspend all academic activities until 8 December 2025 - Secretary, Ministry of Education.

title: President chairs meeting after the breach of Mavil Aru Tank bund
byline: The rescue operation to save the people trapped due to the breach of the Mavil Aru reservoir bund is being carried out under the direct supervision of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Notice on issuance of driving licence at issued
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic has announced that due to a failure in its driving licence computer system caused by adverse weather conditions, operations at key offices, including the Werahera main office, will not be functional tomorrow (1).

title: Colombo–Kandy Main road closed near Yakkala for 15 hours
byline: The Colombo–Kandy main road will be closed from the Yakkala area for the next 15 hours, the Disaster Management Centre stated.

title: Level 3 (Red) landslide evacuation warning issued to several areas in seven districts
byline: A ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide evacuation warning has been issued for multiple areas in seven districts by the National Building and Research Organisation (NBRO).

title: No landslides occurred on the slope of Sri Pada - Bengamuwe Dhammadinna Thero
byline: Venerable Bengamuwe Dhammadinna Thero, the Chief Custodian of the Sri Pada Rajamaha Viharaya, has stated that reports circulating on social media claiming a landslide occurred on the slope of Sri Pada are completely inaccurate.

title: Dedicated phone numbers issued for tourists affected by adverse weather
byline: The Sri Lanka Police has issued dedicated phone numbers to assist foreign nationals who are currently in Sri Lanka and affected by the on-going adverse weather conditions.

title: State of Emergency will solely be used to manage the current crisis, President assures
byline: A State of Emergency has been declared in order to provide the legal safeguards and provisions necessary to manage the prevailing disaster situation and to enable a speedy and efficient recovery process, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated.

title: Revised train timetable announced by Department of Railways
byline: A new train timetable has been issued by the Department of Railways.
